Package cipher

Class DetectEnglish

java.lang.Object
cipher.DetectEnglish
public class DetectEnglish
extends java.lang.Object
A class that contains most of the methods to do with the detection of English in decrypted text and the subsequent respacing.
Author:
Max Wood

  • Constructor Details

    • DetectEnglish

      public DetectEnglish​(FileIO u, NGramAnalyser n)

  • Method Details

    • detectEnglish

      public double detectEnglish​(java.lang.String text)
      Returns what fraction of the text can be called English.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to be analysed.
      Returns:
      Float representing the fraction of text that can be classified as English. Scores above 0.75 for un-spaced text and 0.85 for spaced text are good indications of English.

    • isEnglish

      public double isEnglish​(java.lang.String[] words)
      Returns the fraction of words that are English in a given array.
      Parameters:
      words - An array of words to be analysed for English text.
      Returns:
      Float representing the fraction of words in the array that are English.

    • graphicalRespace

      public java.lang.String graphicalRespace​(java.lang.String text, int maxWordLength)
      Re-spaces text using a graphical method. Sub-methods:

      traverse(WordGraph, String, int)

      score(WordGraph)

      prune(WordGraph)

      reconstruct(WordGraph, StringBuilder)

      Parameters:
      text - The text to be re-spaced.
      maxWordLength - The maximum length of a word that could be possibly recognised.
      Returns:
      The input text, re-spaced.

    • traverse

      private WordGraph traverse​(WordGraph parent, java.lang.String text, int maxWordLength)
      Traverses the input text, building a graph up of possible words in the text and possible words succeeding it.
      Parameters:
      parent - The node in the graph from which successive words are drawn from.
      text - The input text to be examined for words.
      maxWordLength - The maximum length of a word that could be possibly recognised.
      Returns:
      A graph representing all possible English word combinations within the text.

    • score

      private WordGraph score​(WordGraph parent)
      Moves through a graph of possible words in text, scoring each node based on whether or not its children are English words.
      Parameters:
      parent - The node from which children are drawn from to calculate its score.
      Returns:
      The word-graph injested, with scores for each node representing the number of children per node that are English words.

    • prune

      private WordGraph prune​(WordGraph parent)
      For each level on the word-graph, the node with the highest score remains.
      Parameters:
      parent - The node from which child nodes are drawn.
      Returns:
      A path graph of all the detectable English words that can be predicted to exist in the target text.

    • reconstruct

      private java.lang.StringBuilder reconstruct​(WordGraph parent, java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
      Generates an English string from an input path graph.
      Parameters:
      parent - The node from which child nodes are drawn.
      sb - A string-builder used during recursive calls of this function.
      Returns:
      A string-builder containing all the English words in the path graph, concatenated.

    • chiSquaredTest

      public double chiSquaredTest​(java.lang.String text)
      Gives the score of the given text as how close the text is to English.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to be analysed.
      Returns:
      The Chi Squared value.

    • isEnglish

      public boolean isEnglish​(java.lang.String word)
      Determines if a single word exists in the English language.
      Parameters:
      word - The word to be examined
      Returns:
      Boolean whether word is English or not.

    • greedyRespace

      private java.lang.String greedyRespace​(java.lang.String toAnalyse, int longest)
      A recursive greedy word-search algorithm designed to operate quickly rather than accurately on a given piece of English text.
      Parameters:
      toAnalyse - The text to be re-spaced.
      longest - The length of the longest possible word to be found.
      Returns:
      The re-spaced text.

    • greedyWrapper

      public java.lang.String greedyWrapper​(java.lang.String toAnalyse, int longest)
      A wrapper method to handle String formatting for greedyRespace(String, int).
      Parameters:
      toAnalyse - The String to be re-spaced.
      longest - The length of the longest word that could be found.
      Returns:
      A properly formatted version of the re-spaced text.
